com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl

Class HighPerformanceLogEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.HighPerformanceLogEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExternalizableData

    public class HighPerformanceLogEvent
extends Object
implements ExternalizableData
    High performance logging event class.

    This class is designed to be used in a java.lang.ThreadLocal context. The thread name is cached once on creation then used for each subsequent event. This behaviour may be overridden explicitly via refreshThreadName().

    This class has an efficient serialization and de-serialization mechanism for fast inter-thread communication and also persistence. The serialized representation is in two parts:

    1. Header - fixed part
    2. Data - variable part

    See the HighPerformanceLogEvent.Offset definitions for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(Level levelToSet,
                BytesSegment loggerNameToSet,
                org.slf4j.Marker markerToSet,
                BytesSegment messageToSet,
                Throwable throwableToSet)
        Set logging event information.

        Calling this method is equivalent to calling: 

         event.set(WallClock.nanoTime(), levelToSet, loggerNameToSet, markerToSet, messageToSet, throwableToSet);
        Parameters:
        levelToSet - The logging level.
        loggerNameToSet - The logger name. A reference to the specified logger name is stored.
        markerToSet - The log message marker. A reference to the specified marker is stored.
        messageToSet - The log message. A reference to the specified log message is stored.
        throwableToSet - The throwable associated with this log message (if any). May be null.
        See Also:
        WallClock.nanoTime()

      • set

        public void set(long timestampNs,
                Level levelToSet,
                BytesSegment loggerNameToSet,
                org.slf4j.Marker markerToSet,
                BytesSegment messageToSet,
                Throwable throwableToSet)
        Set the logging event information.
        Parameters:
        timestampNs - The timestamp.
        levelToSet - The logging level.
        loggerNameToSet - The logger name. A reference to the specified logger name is stored.
        markerToSet - The log message marker. A reference to the specified marker is stored.
        messageToSet - The log message. A reference to the specified log message is stored.
        throwableToSet - The throwable associated with this log message (if any). May be null.

      • refreshThreadName

        public void refreshThreadName()
        Force an explicit refresh (and associated re-caching) of the calling thread's name.

        This method must be used to ensure the correct thread name is recorded when instances of this class are not being used in thread local context.

      • getFilePosition

        public long getFilePosition()
        Return the file position associated with this event.

        Note that the file position is not stored with the event on disk. However, it can be inferred as events are read from disk and stored here for convenience if necessary.

        Returns:
        The file position corresponding to the start of this event on disk. This is not guaranteed to be set.

      • setFilePosition

        public void setFilePosition(long filePosition)
        Set the file position associated with this event.
        Parameters:
        filePosition - The file position corresponding to the start of this event on disk.
